title: Bug 108822: Improper logic for disk sorting with border row value
OB: When sorting on disk, if sorting is performed on 40000 rows of data, and the program is set to process only the data less than 40000 rows, the following operations are performed by the program:
EB: The program should implement more accurate logic to handle disk sorting when there is a border value for the row
SR:
1. Prepare a dataset with 40000 rows of data
2. Set the program to process only the data less than 40000 rows
3. Sort the data on disk
4. Observe the sorting behavior to see if it is processed accurately and consistently for all rows
